verses.verse: O LORD our God, (2 Chr. 12:8) masters besides You Have had dominion over us; But by You only we make mention of Your name.
They are dead, they will not live; They are deceased, they will not rise. Therefore You have punished and destroyed them, And made all their memory to (Eccl. 9:5; Is. 14:22) perish.
You have increased the nation, O LORD, You have (Is. 9:3) increased the nation; You are glorified; You have expanded all the borders of the land.
LORD, (Is. 37:3; Hos. 5:15) in trouble they have visited You, They poured out a prayer when Your chastening was upon them.
As (Is. 13:8; (John 16:21)) a woman with child Is in pain and cries out in her pangs, When she draws near the time of her delivery, So have we been in Your sight, O LORD.

We have been with child, we have been in pain; We have, as it were, brought forth wind; We have not accomplished any deliverance in the earth, Nor have (Ps. 17:14) the inhabitants of the world fallen.

(Is. 25:8; (Ezek. 37:1-14)) Your dead shall live; Together with my dead body they shall arise. ((Dan. 12:2); Hos. 13:14) Awake and sing, you who dwell in dust; For your dew is like the dew of herbs, And the earth shall cast out the dead.

Take Refuge from the Coming JudgmentCome, my people, (Ex. 12:22, 23; (Ps. 91:1, 4)) enter your chambers, And shut your doors behind you; Hide yourself, as it were, ((Ps. 30:5; Is. 54:7, 8; 2 Cor. 4:17)) for a little moment, Until the indignation is past.
For behold, the LORD (Mic. 1:3; (Jude 14)) comes out of His place To punish the inhabitants of the earth for their iniquity; The earth will also disclose her blood, And will no more cover her slain.

In that day the LORD with His severe sword, great and strong, Will punish Leviathan the fleeing serpent, (Gen. 3:1; Ps. 74:13, 14; Rev. 12:9, 15) Leviathan that twisted serpent; And He will slay (Is. 51:9; Ezek. 29:3; 32:2) the reptile that is in the sea.
The Restoration of IsraelIn that day (Is. 5:1) sing to her, (Ps. 80:8; Is. 5:7; Jer. 2:21) â€œA vineyard of red wine!
(1 Sam. 2:9; Ps. 121:4, 5; Is. 31:5; (John 10:28)) I, the LORD, keep it, I water it every moment; Lest any hurt it, I keep it night and day.
Fury is not in Me. Who would set (2 Sam. 23:6; Is. 9:18) briers and thorns Against Me in battle? I would go through them, I would burn them together.
